appendix.title: Terminology and general vocabulary
appendix.para: The following two tables define technical terms and general vocabulary for use in SUSE documentation. See also .

sect1.title: Terminology
sect1.para: The following table defines the correct spellings and denominations for technical terms in SUSE documentation. Always use the entry listed under Accepted in the table below. All terms are reproduced in sentence-style capitalization.

sect1.title: General vocabulary
sect1.para: The following table defines the correct spellings and denominations for general vocabulary in SUSE documentation. Always use the entry listed under Accepted in the table below. All entries are reproduced in sentence-style capitalization.

row.entry: adverb; only use once in the meaning of one time only
conjunction; only use while in the meaning of during the time that
conjunction; only use while in the meaning of during the time that
conjunction; only use while in the meaning of during the time that
verb; use can to express an ability, only use may to express permissions sought/given.
verb; use could to express a possibility, only use may to express permissions sought/given.
abbreviation; avoid; do not use together with for example and such as; always precede with a comma.
pronoun; use if an event depends on a condition; also see when and whether
verb; use might to express a possibility, only use may to express permissions sought/given
(to) wish sth., (to) wish for sth., would like sth.
adverb; use once only in the meaning one time only
pronoun; use if an event is inevitable; also see if

pronoun; use to present two alternatives which are not conditions, otherwise use if; see also if sknorr, 2014-02-18: This is helpful: https://www.grammar-monster.com/easily_confused/if_and_whether.htm
as regards, in regard to, with regards to
